questions.text: On MRI scan, which of the following is hyperintense on T2-weighted images?

Which of the following CT features is not frequently observed in COVID-19 pneumonia?

options.label: A
options.text: Multifocal ground glass opacities (GGO) with peripheral distribution

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Multifocal ground glass opacities (GGO) with peripheral distribution is the feature, which has been reported most often in the context of COVID-19 pneumonia. Consolidation and crazy paving are less frequent than ground glass opacities, but still quite common and point towards disease progression.
  • • Lymphadenopathy is a rare finding in COVID-19 pneumonia, thus the absence of lymphadenopathy is common.
  • • Pleural effusions are also rare and point towards a complication or an additional different underlying disease. This is the correct answer.Pleural effusions are also rare and point towards a complication or an additional different underlying disease. This is the correct answer.

A 6-month-old male infant who is limp and exhibiting obtundation in the morning is brought to the emergency department. Bedside blood analysis reveals a significant metabolic acidosis, including an elevated lactate level and a capillary blood glucose level of 35 mg/dL (1.9 mmol/L) and 3+ ketones in the urine. His newborn screening results were normal. His parents report that he only recently has been able to sleep through the night without waking for a feeding and that he has had a few episodes of morning lethargy that improved after his first morning feeding. The infant appears small and nearly comatose. He has chubby cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin. He has a temperature of 37.8°C, a heart rate of 155 beats/min, a respiratory rate of 15 breaths/min, and a blood pressure of 75/45 mm Hg. Cardiac examination reveals no murmur and a normal S1 and S2. The liver edge is palpable 3 cm below the right costal margin. The remainder of the physical examination findings are unremarkable. Of the following, the MOST likely diagnosis is

questions.text: Dix Hallpike maneuver is used to assess –

options.label: A
options.text: Differentiate peripheral and central lesions of vestibular system

questions.correct_answer: A. Differentiate peripheral and central lesions of vestibular system
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • Hallpike test is a test for assessing vestibular function.
  • ↳ • It is particularly useful when patients complain of vertigo in certain head positions. It helps to differentiate peripheral and central lesions.
  • ↳ • Patient sits on a couch. Examiner holds the patients head, turns it 45º to the right and then places the patient in supine position so that his head hangs 30º below the horizontal. Patient’s eyes are observed for nystagmus.
  • ↳ THE TEST IS REPEATED WITH HEAD TURNED TO LEFT.
  • ↳ Four parameters of nystagmus are observed :- latency, duration, direction, fatigability. Peripheral causes of BPPV can be differentiated from central causes (like tumors of fourth ventricle, cerebellum, temporal lobe, Multiple sclerosis, ? ICT) by observing the characteristic of nystagmus.

questions.text: All of the following are theories for primary acquired cholesteatoma except –
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ Primary acquired cholesteatoma
  • ↳ • There is no history of previous otitis media or a pre – existing perforation. Theories for its genesis are :-
  • ↳ (i) Retraction pocket (Wittmaack’s theory).
  • ↳ (ii) Basal cell hyperplasia (Ruedis theory).
  • ↳ (iii) Squamous metaplasia (Sade’s theory).
  • ↳ Secondary acquired chlesteatoma. There is pre – existing perforation in pars tensa.
  • ↳ • Theories on genesis include :-
  • ↳ (i) Epithelial invasion (Habermann’s theory).
  • ↳ (ii) Metaplasia.

questions.text: A 77 year old woman presented to our service with history of nasal block, nasal discharge and epistaxis since 10 years. On examination, there was a fleshy polypoidal mass seen filling the entire right nasal cavity. CT scan of the osteomeatal complex revealed a soft tissue density lesion occupying the entire right nasal cavity, projecting through the posterior choanae into the nasopharynx. The lesion extended superiorly to the cribriform plate but without intracranial or orbital extension.She was a known case of diabetes and hypertension on long term aspirin treatment.
Auditory steady-state responses (ASSR) differ from auditory brainstem response (ABR) as described by which of the statements below?

options.label: A
options.text: ABRs are better technique for evaluating hearing aid performance.

options.label: B
options.text: ABRs can be used for cochlear-implant candidacy for children and adults, whereas ASSR is only indicated for adults.

options.label: C
options.text: ASSR can be used to measure frequency-specific information for sound > 120 dB.

options.label: D
options.text: ABR is more time efficient (more thresholds measured in a shorter time period).

questions.correct_answer: C. ASSR can be used to measure frequency-specific information for sound > 120 dB.

questions.text: Measures for preventing post cochlear implantation meningitis include all of the following except for:

options.label: B
options.text: Avoiding a separate intracochlear electrode positioner

options.label: C
options.text: Coating the array with antibiotic solutions

questions.correct_answer: C. Coating the array with antibiotic solutions

questions.text: For cricoid pressure to be effective the following are required except:

options.label: C
options.text: Pressure on the oesophagus against the vertebral body.

questions.text: A 35-year-old male is listed for electroconvulsive therapy. He is medically fit but has a family history of allergy to Suxamethonium. You are advised by the consultant to use rocuronium and sugammadex. Which of the following statements is true regarding sugammadex?

options.label: B
options.text: Sugammadex can be used for all non-depolarising muscle relaxants.

options.label: C
options.text: The drug forms complex atracurium and inactivates it.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a modified cyclodextrin molecule

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a modified cyclodextrin molecule

questions.text: Which of the following agents causes maximum decrease in systemic vascular resistance?
Local anaesthetics alter nerve function by their action on sodium channels. Which of the following statements about the same are correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Local anesthetics binding results in cessation of the depolarization by preventing sodium ions entering the cell

options.label: B
options.text: Sodium channels in the resting state have a high affinity for local anaesthetic

options.label: C
options.text: The binding of bupivacaine to the sodium channel is irreversible

options.label: D
options.text: Local anaesthetics bind directly to the extracellular portion of the sodium channel to exert the effect

questions.correct_answer: A. Local anesthetics binding results in cessation of the depolarization by preventing sodium ions entering the cell

questions.text: The 2020 AHA guidelines for CPR recommended BLS sequence of steps to be:
Which of the following transport mechanisms is not rate limited by an intrinsic T max ?

options.label: B
options.text: Primary active transport via carrier proteins

options.label: C
options.text: Secondary active co-transport via carrier proteins

options.label: D
options.text: Diffusion of ions through protein channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Diffusion of ions through protein channels

questions.text: While participating in a cardiovascular physiology experiment, a Physiology PG isolated the common carotid artery of an experimental animal and partially constricts the artery with a tie around the vessel. Which of the following changes is not expected to occur in response to constriction of the carotid artery?

A 20-year-old man has a vehicular accident that completely eliminates nerve traffic in the right half of his spinal cord at C2. Loss of which of the following functions is most likely in the left hand of this man?
Which of the following statement is false about inflammatory mediators?

options.label: A
options.text: LT B4 causes increased vascular permeability

options.label: C
options.text: Fever is due to PGE2 secretion in brain

questions.correct_answer: A. LT B4 causes increased vascular permeability

questions.text: Concretio-cordis is a term referred to which pathology?
Which of the following functions does RIP complex serve?

options.label: B
options.text: Helps in pathogen recognition by neutrophils

questions.text: Hematological manifestations of lupus are which type of hypersensitivity reaction?

A 70-year-old man presents with refractory anemia, he has taken iron tablets for few months which cured symptoms but have started again after stopping. Peripheral blood examination is as shown in the image. what is next investigation in this patient?

A 55-year male presents with easy fatigue, clinical examination is unremarkable except for patiechae all over body. Blood examination shows platelet count of 20,000. Hb 6g/dL, TLC is 3000. Which of the following is likely diagnosis amongst these?
A boy presents with hypocalcemic tetany, cleft palate and is having recurrent infections.which of the following genetic abnormality is most likely to be seen in this child?

options.label: A
options.text: Proliferation of blasts (immature hematopoietic cells) in the bone marrow

options.label: C
options.text: Proliferation of blasts (immature hematopoietic cells) outside the bone marrow

questions.text: The following is a histological image from a a squamous cell carcinoma. Which of the following is correct description of the features seen in the image?

A 65-year male patient presents with weight loss for few months and mucosal bleeding for last two days. PT, APTT TT and BT are increased. You start suspecting a solid organ malignancy, which one is it likely to be?
A patient is having recurrent diarrhoea, steatorrhoea and anemia. Blood examination shows acanthocytes. What is most likely cause?
GFAP is a tumor marker for?
Which of the following complication doesnot occur immediately during transfusion?

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain’t true about this condition from the following options ?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn’s Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: All of the following statements are TRUE , except :

options.label: A
options.text: Kyphoplasty incorporates injection of PMMA ( Polymethylene methacrylate ) into the collapsed vertebral body via balloon technique

options.label: B
options.text: Kyphoplasty is safe and superior to Vertebroplasty since there are less chances of extravasation of cement in the former technique

options.label: C
options.text: Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

options.label: D
options.text: Cement induced vertebral height inflation corrects not only the posture but also helps in relieving the bone pains

questions.correct_answer: C. Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

questions.text: A 7 year old boy is brought by parents to Ortho OPD with chief complains of dull aching pain and inability to squat. His problems started with intense pain in the right hip two weeks ago for which he was treated conservatively and symptomatically. His blood investigations show raised ESR with other counts almost normal. X rays were done which showed osteopenia and mild erosions around the hip joint mainly towards the acetabular side. Which of the following is the correct diagnosis ?
Maxpage Surgery is :

options.label: A
options.text: Distal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

options.label: B
options.text: Proximal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

options.label: C
options.text: Distal Sliding of Common Extensor Origin

options.label: D
options.text: Proximal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

questions.correct_answer: A. Distal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

questions.text: Which of the following Implant terminology doesn't match with its Mechanism of Action?
questions.correct_answer: D. Steinmann's Pin: Three Point Fixation

options.label: A
options.text: There is thyroid cell hyperplasia and hypertrophy in pregnancy which leads to goiter in pregnancy

options.text: Total T3 and T4 levels increase in pregnancy
